sources.full: Warlock Lair 50: The Light of Memoria

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spectral memory can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the spectral memory has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Remembered Expertise
entries: If the spectral memory makes an attack roll while at least one creature within 30 feet of it is missing a memory from Memory Drain, the spectral memory can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll.

action.name: Memory Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or lose a cherished memory. This loss lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. Whenever a creature that is missing a memory makes an ability check or attack roll, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the ability check or attack roll.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The shroud can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Shadow Evolution
entries: Shrouds instantly become {@creature shadow||shadows} once they cause a total of 12 damage. Any damage they’ve suffered is subtracted from the shadow’s total hit points or abilities.

trait.name: Shroud Stealth
entries: When in dim light or darkness, the shroud can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the shroud has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Strength Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) necrotic damage, and the target’s Strength score is reduced by one-half that amount. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new {@creature shadow} rises from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later.
{@i Shrouds appear much like they did in life, only translucent and immaterial. Their voices are weak.}

entries.name: Bitter Spirits
entries: Shrouds are transitional creatures: remnants of wicked people who died but refuse to rest in peace, yet have not grown strong enough to become {@creature shadow||shadows}. They are aggressive enemies of all living creatures and the light that nurtures life. Shrouds blend naturally into darkness, but they stand out starkly in bright light.

entries.name: Thin Outlines
entries: Shrouds look like flickering shadowy outlines of the people they were before they died, retaining the same height and body type.

entries.name: Repetitive Speech
entries: Shrouds cannot converse, but they occasionally can be heard cruelly whispering a name, term, or phrase over and over again: something that must have had meaning to them in life.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A shroud doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

item.name: Amulet of Memory
entries: Made of gold or silver, this spherical locket is engraved with two cresting waves facing away from each other while bound in a twisted loop. It preserves a memory to be re-experienced later.

While wearing this amulet, you can use an action to speak the command word and open the locket. The open locket stores what you see and experience for up to 10 minutes. You can shut the locket at any time (no action required), stopping the memory recording. Opening the locket with the command word again overwrites the contained memory.

While a memory is stored, you or another creature can touch the locket to experience the memory from the beginning. Breaking contact ends the memory early. In addition, you have advantage on any skill check related to details or knowledge of the stored memory.

If you die while wearing the amulet, it preserves you. Your body is affected by the {@spell gentle repose} spell until the amulet is removed or until you are restored to life. In addition, at the moment of your death, you can store any memory into the amulet. A creature touching the amulet perceives the memory stored there even after your death.
Attuning to an amulet of memory removes any prior memories stored in it.
